{{cpp/named req/title|SeedSequence|notes={{mark since c++11}}}}
{{cpp/named req/navbar}}

A {{named req|SeedSequence}} is an object that produces unsigned integer values {{math|i}} in the range {{math|0 â‰¤ i &lt; 2{{su|p=32}}}} based on a consumed range of integer data.

===Requirements===
*{{ttb|S}} is a {{named req/core|SeedSequence}} type.
*{{ttb|q}} is an object of {{tt|S}} and {{ttb|r}} is a potentially constant object of {{tt|S}}.
*{{ttb|T}} is the {{tt|result_type}}.
*{{ttb|ib}}, {{ttb|ie}} are {{named req|InputIterator}}s with a {{tt|value_type}} of unsigned integer values of at least 32&amp;nbsp;bits.
*{{ttb|il}} is a {{c|std::initializer_list&lt;T&gt;}}.
*{{ttb|rb}}, {{ttb|re}} are {{rlp|OutputIterator|mutable}} {{named req|RandomAccessIterator}}s with a {{tt|value_type}} of unsigned integer values of at least 32&amp;nbsp;bits.
*{{ttb|ob}} is a {{named req|OutputIterator}}.

{|class=wikitable
!Expression||Type||Notes||Complexity
|-
|{{tt|S::result_type}}||{{tt|T}}||Unsigned integer of at least 32 bits.||Compile-time
|-
|{{tt|S()}}||||Creates a seed sequence with the same initial state as other default-constructed seed sequences of type {{tt|S}}.||Constant
|-
|{{tt|S(ib, ie)}}||||Creates a seed sequence with internal state depending on some or all supplied input bits by {{range|ib|ie}}.||{{math|O(ie - ib)}}
|-
|{{tt|S(il)}}||||The same as {{tt|S(il.begin(), il.end())}}.||
|-
|{{tt|q.generate(rb, re)}}||{{tt|void}}||Fills {{range|rb|re}} with 32-bit quantities depending on the initial supplied values and potential previous calls to {{tt|generate}}. If {{tt|rb {{==}} re}}, it does nothing.||{{math|O(re - rb)}}
|-
|{{tt|r.size()}}||{{tt|size_t}}||The amount of 32-bit integers copied by {{tt|param}}.||Constant
|-
|{{tt|r.param(ob)}}||{{tt|void}}||Copies 32-bit values to {{tt|ob}} that would reproduce the current state of the object if passed to a constructor of {{tt|S}}.||{{math|O(r.size())}}
|-
|}
